page.title: 11Biography.
page.content: Over a century ago, an eccentric gentleman called Colonel George Tomline who lived in a large house on the banks of the River Orwell at Nacton between Ipswich and Felixstowe, wanted to commercialise his other property on the Landguard area of Felixstowe. He built a railway line from Westerfield to link Felixstowe with the then flour- ishing Great Eastern Railway and event- ually, he hoped, with the industrial Midlands. Named the Felixstowe Railway and Pier Co., the first train arrived in Felixstowe at the Beach Station in May 1877. Tomline also had the creek entrance dug out, which was the start of the Felixstowe Dock and Railway Company.
